entities.name: Contract
entities.description: A contract is a formal agreement between two or more parties.

entities.name: Service Type
entities.description: The type of service provided in a contract.

entities.name: Rate
entities.description: A rate is a specific price or cost associated with a service defined in the contract.

entities.name: Rate Type
entities.description: A rate type defines the various pricing structures that can be applied to a service or contract.

entities.name: Rate Break
entities.description: A rate break defines the conditions under which a different rate applies.

entities.name: Demurrage Rates
entities.description: Demurrage rates are charges applied for the prolonged use of a service beyond the agreed-upon time.

entities.name: Demurrage Rates Break
entities.description: A rate break defines the conditions under which a different rate applies.

entities.name: Detention Rates
entities.description: Detention rates are charges applied for the prolonged use of a service beyond the agreed-upon time.

entities.name: Detention Rates Break
entities.description: A rate break defines the conditions under which a different rate applies.

entities.name: Contract Charge
entities.description: The charges applied for the utilisation of the services defined in the contract.

entities.name: Service Commitment
entities.description: The commitment to provide a service at a defined level.
